label: 世話物
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: Sewamono concerned commoners--shopkeepers, farmers, prostitutes--and were often based on a recent incident--a murder, theft, swindle, or arson case....  The most representative of the sewamono concern a hopeless love that leads to a double suice (shinjū) (p. 755). [心中]
